Posts.Content: Daisy1966 wrote: a year ago during mammogram, microcalcifications were found and was scheduled to go back for another mammogram, the diagnostic one.  Then again in 6 months, that was in February, they were still there and hadn't changed.  Went in Friday for the 6 month diagnositc mammogram and they had the 3D machine this time.  A spot was found and I was put in another room for an ultrasound.  The tech walks out and then she comes back in with a woman dressed in a suit, and I'm think OMG!  WTH!!!!  She said it was a cyst and we could either wait or get it biopsied.  Well of course I said biopsy it right away.  Well it's today and I'm very nervous.  I'm not sure if the spot was there before and just now could see it because of the 3D machine or has just developed within the last 6 months.  I think they told me, but I was a little distracted to remember.  I will have to ask again today.  They also said they weren't worried about the microcalcifications anymore.  I was a little confused about that, originally told they track those for 2 years??   I've been told I have dense breasts.  I'm 45 years old and I know this kind of thing happens to women my age.  I know I'm not making alot of sense.  I just needed to vent a little.  :)  And maybe a little reassurance that I'm sure is nothing.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Brand new here, but very worried....biopsy today Daisy1966 Infobabe

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2012 08:10AM Daisy1966 wrote: Biopsy wasn't as bad as I was fearing! Haven't heard results yet. Boob is sore, but not too bad, bruised tho. Doctor didn't seem concerned yesterday. :)
Posts.Title: Brand new here, but very worried....biopsy today Daisy1966 Infobabe
